page.title: 19BUCTON CASTLE (CONT.)
page.content: The reason the Roman roads ran on the high uplands and round the crest of the hillsides, was the far different picture the valley would have presented at that time. Thick forests of oak, elm, beech, ash, and hazel extensively covered the valley. The name {Micklehurst }meaning 'little wood' was the name originally applied to the dispersed settlement of {Higher {Micklehurst,}just below the paved Roman Road, which is the extent of the tree-line to-day, as it would also have been at that time. On the eastern side of the valley too, the main settlement would be dispersed around the present {Upper Mossley }area.
